result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis J Lapinskas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation. Must be 100% compliant.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample, if not previously provide, and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate, including aftercare.  Follow through with recommendations.  Do not associate with any convicted of a drug offense unless it is in a treatment setting.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes:
Firearm warning given.  Voting is prohibited until sentence is
complete and civil rights have been restored.   Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP.

records.addlTxt: DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.

Court Reporter Leslie Johnson. Defendant Dennis J Lapinskas in court with attorney Anthony Jackson.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State indicated no necessity for Chapter 950 compliance; no additions or corrections to revocation packet.
Atty Jackson indicated no additions or corrections to revocation packet.

State recommends sentence on the high end of DOC recommendation.
Defense requests jail for 7 months.  

BTC:  9 months RCJ
CIP and SAT eligible
firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA assmt.
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting
No action at this time regarding operating privileges
for defendant from Winnebago County Jail for SEHR on 04-12-2018 at 1:30 pm (emailed RCSO 03-06-2018 @ 2:26 pm)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 12, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Plea hearing on June 10, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Keith David O'Donnell in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that the defendant isn't able to get here due to transportations issues due to the storm.  The State is not asking for BW/BF, simply another COP  Plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Dennis J Lapinskas in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Defense asks for COP

BTC: Deft reminded to go to ZCI after every court appearance.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Dennis J Lapinskas in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for an add'l status as they are waiting additional discovery from the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dennis J Lapinskas in court with attorney Erin Larsen for Atty Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Dennis J Lapinskas in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.   Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dennis J Lapinskas in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Dennis J Lapinskas in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
